Living a Simple Life

Notion
Living a Simple Life
Simple living encompasses a number of different voluntary practices to simplify one's lifestyle. These may include, for example, reducing one's possessions, generally referred to as minimalism, or increasing self-sufficiency. Simple living may be characterized by individuals being satisfied with what they have rather than want. - Wikipedia
Simplicity is anything which can be easily thought of and discussed but requires a lot of hard work to implement and execute. An idealistic and simple world can be thought of and thousands of pages can be written on how we can get there, but when it comes to actually taking steps to achieve simplicity, almost all fail. So, why chase simplicity?
Simplicity is defined not just by your lifestyle, or the things you posses but also by the mindset. Something easy to understand or explain seems simple, in contrast to something complicated. Alternatively, as Herbert A. Simon suggests, something is simple or complex depending on the way we choose to describe it. History has set us several examples in the past that as humanity tries to make things simpler and simpler it rather becomes complex and chaotic. (we could put examples here). Let us consider transportation, horses, trams, railway, etc were sufficient enough for decades. Not only did in involve public transportation for all, it was more efficient and less taxing on the environment. But then came the cars - In the hopes to give freedom to the person and make transport simpler, the story was otherwise. Especially in the US, where somehow you have all the freedoms - people wanted to be free and bought cars, slowly their railroad system vanished along with massive need for creating 4-6-8 lane highways to carry the vast amount of traffic, which was previously less.
The Why
The process of attaining simplicity requires a drive, persistence and perseverance. It is a test of the mind, body and soul. Thus, the lessons learnt from this journey justify all efforts. To strive for simplicity is to focus on utilising resources while forgetting luxury. It is like a challenge to stay away of consumerism.
